description.narrative: Conservación de la biodiversidad en paisajes impactados por la minería en la Región del Chocó Biogeográfico
first-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Protection of biodiversity in areas highly vulnerable to the indirect effects of mining
Area ha of land degradated by mining under short and medium term restoration processes protocol in key biodiversity areas

comment.narrative: 100 ha

An agreement with the Institute of Environmental Investigations of the Pacific IIAP was established to implement the ecological restoration protocol at the Choco region starting with the identification of the areas to be intervened The diagnosis of at least 200 hectares identified for restoration will take place local capacity to implement the methodology of the protocol will be analyzed and preliminary analysis of socioenvironmental viability of the areas identified restoration will take place
100 ha

An agreement with the Institute of Environmental Investigations of the Pacific IIAP was established to implement the ecological restoration protocol at the Choco region starting with the identification of the areas to be intervened The diagnosis of at least 200 hectares identified for restoration will take place local capacity to implement the methodology of the protocol will be analyzed and preliminary analysis of socioenvironmental viability of the areas identified restoration will take place

description.narrative: Avoided deforestation ha at the end of project

comment.narrative: Avoided deforestation will be reported through REDD projects An agreement with Cocomacia was formulated in order to perform a preliminary analysis of technical economic social and institutional feasibility of REDD projects in the priority areas of the project Under the agreement secondary information for socioenvironmental characterization of communities that have shown interest in REDD projects will be collected the lessons learned from REDD processes implemented or being implemented in the Chocó will be systematized The social technical and economic viability of at least 10 potential communities to implement REDD projects is going to be preliminarily analyzed

Avoided deforestation will be reported through REDD projects An agreement with Cocomacia was formulated in order to perform a preliminary analysis of technical economic social and institutional feasibility of REDD projects in the priority areas of the project Under the agreement secondary information for socioenvironmental characterization of communities that have shown interest in REDD projects will be collected the lessons learned from REDD processes implemented or being implemented in the Chocó will be systematized The social technical and economic viability of at least 10 potential communities to implement REDD projects is going to be preliminarily analyzed

description.narrative: Change in average annual income of members of local communities including women and men as a result of the sale of assai palm Euterpe oleracea and jagua American Genipa

comment.narrative:
Women X
Men X
The goal will be participatory defined on the first six months of the project

In the process of updating the management plans productive activities aimed at improving family income will be included For this a baseline will be made for families to be included in these processes
At the same time a strategy will be designed to include a gender perspective in these activities and thus to ensure equality between men and women For this it is important to consider the roles of men and women within their communities and organizations so that we can empower them and contribute to equitable development of families and communities
A gender strategy will also be included in the training program linked with the other components of the project

Women X
Men X
The goal will be participatory defined on the first six months of the project

In the process of updating the management plans productive activities aimed at improving family income will be included For this a baseline will be made for families to be included in these processes
At the same time a strategy will be designed to include a gender perspective in these activities and thus to ensure equality between men and women For this it is important to consider the roles of men and women within their communities and organizations so that we can empower them and contribute to equitable development of families and communities
A gender strategy will also be included in the training program linked with the other components of the project

description.narrative: Number of initiatives for sustainable use of biodiversity resources being marketed

comment.narrative: Two 2 nontimber products Naidi Euterpe oleracea and Jagua American Genipa

It was made an evaluation of the productive chains of Naidi and Jagua finding that they are currently limited conditions for the development of these productive chains in the project areas obtaining resource use licences and rupture of relations between suppliers and retailers
Considering the above an assessment of the problem is being conducted to determine ways to continue and an analysis is going on to understand the current situation in the region with respect to the marketing of nontimber forest products NTFP and also the identification of key actors who have been involved in the processes among which are private actors Ecoflora and Espavé Bioinnova Corporation public institutions IIAP Codechoco MADS community stakeholders Cocomacia and Asocasan with other projects such as the GEF Nagoya
Progress is being made in the identification and characterization of productive initiatives that are currently developed from nontimber forest products NTFP and has potential for generating income for communities in the Choco region with emphasis on the areas impacted by mining This exercise will a Identify NTFPs generating income for communities b Identify the status of the models companies initiatives or proposed business plans or systems implementation for NTFP c Identify feasibility studies and supply chains of NTFP being carried out d identify and characterize the NTFP harvesting protocols that exist for the Chocó e To propose an analysis matrix state models or business plans with variables regarding environmental social and economic and legal sustainability
Two 2 nontimber products Naidi Euterpe oleracea and Jagua American Genipa

It was made an evaluation of the productive chains of Naidi and Jagua finding that they are currently limited conditions for the development of these productive chains in the project areas obtaining resource use licences and rupture of relations between suppliers and retailers
Considering the above an assessment of the problem is being conducted to determine ways to continue and an analysis is going on to understand the current situation in the region with respect to the marketing of nontimber forest products NTFP and also the identification of key actors who have been involved in the processes among which are private actors Ecoflora and Espavé Bioinnova Corporation public institutions IIAP Codechoco MADS community stakeholders Cocomacia and Asocasan with other projects such as the GEF Nagoya
Progress is being made in the identification and characterization of productive initiatives that are currently developed from nontimber forest products NTFP and has potential for generating income for communities in the Choco region with emphasis on the areas impacted by mining This exercise will a Identify NTFPs generating income for communities b Identify the status of the models companies initiatives or proposed business plans or systems implementation for NTFP c Identify feasibility studies and supply chains of NTFP being carried out d identify and characterize the NTFP harvesting protocols that exist for the Chocó e To propose an analysis matrix state models or business plans with variables regarding environmental social and economic and legal sustainability

description.narrative: Number of new Multiple Use Protected Areas MUPA created

comment.narrative:
An analysis of the document Conservation priorities for the Chocó ecoregion was held including extra criteria to select new protected areas initiatives such as Being part of the temporary reserve of natural resources have mining pressures in the zone include indigenous communities on its buffer zone and to be a conservation priority for the Regional System of Protected Areas from the Pacific RSPAP Through this analysis two 2 initiatives were selected to promote their declaration process Páramo del Duende and Bosques del Citará Upper part of the Atrato basin
There is an agreement with the Constructores de Paz foundation to support the regional environmental authority Codechoco in the process of declaring the multiple use protected area MUPA of Cuenca alta del río Atrato in the department of Chocó
Through this agreement a work plan will be set and other activities are going to be held such as the design and delimitation of the PA and the generation of the final protocol to conclude with the formal creation
In addition processes of creation of new protected areas have been identified in the Cauca and Nariño departments that are included in the Choco ecoregion

There is an agreement with the Constructores de Paz foundation to support the regional environmental authority Codechoco in the process of declaring the multiple use protected area MUPA of Cuenca alta del río Atrato in the department of Chocó
Through this agreement a work plan will be set and other activities are going to be held such as the design and delimitation of the PA and the generation of the final protocol to conclude with the formal creation
In addition processes of creation of new protected areas have been identified in the Cauca and Nariño departments that are included in the Choco ecoregion

description.narrative: of municipal planning instruments POT that includes the priority zones for conservation and zoning to deal with direct and indirect impacts of mining on biodiversity and ecosystem services

comment.narrative:
A general information analysis was held for the environmental biodiversity ecosystem services and environmental determinants components of the Territorial Zoning Plans POT in the municipalities of Murindó Vigia del Fuerte Tado and Buenaventura In the 9 prioritized municipalities the advances of the POMCAS were revised
It was formulated an agreement with the IIAP to advance in the inclusion on the POT of biodiversity protection tools against mining in the municipalities of Tado and Vigia del Fuerte Additionally through this agreement the identification of direct and indirect impacts of mining and its relationship to ecosystem services in these two municipalities will be held

A general information analysis was held for the environmental biodiversity ecosystem services and environmental determinants components of the Territorial Zoning Plans POT in the municipalities of Murindó Vigia del Fuerte Tado and Buenaventura In the 9 prioritized municipalities the advances of the POMCAS were revised
It was formulated an agreement with the IIAP to advance in the inclusion on the POT of biodiversity protection tools against mining in the municipalities of Tado and Vigia del Fuerte Additionally through this agreement the identification of direct and indirect impacts of mining and its relationship to ecosystem services in these two municipalities will be held

description.narrative: Four 4 protected areas increase control and surveillance capacity Measured by METT

comment.narrative:
PNN Las Orquídeas 2 Protection systems are moderately effective in controlling the use of access resource
PNN Tatamá 1 Protection systems are only partially effective in controlling access using resource
PNN Farallones de Cali 1 Protection systems are only partially effective in controlling access using resource
PNN Munchique 2 Protection systems are moderately effective in controlling the use of access resource

PNN Las Orquídeas 3 Protection systems are largely or wholly effective in controlling the use of access resource
PNN Tatamá 3 Protection systems are largely or wholly effective in controlling the use of access resource
PNN Farallones de Cali 3 Protection systems are largely or wholly effective in controlling the use of access resource
PNN Munchique 3 Protection systems are largely or wholly effective in controlling the use of access resource

5 work agreements have been signed Corpocam and Asocasan Tatama Amatea Farallones Corpohabitats Munchique and Colombian Association of Aquaculture Orquideas for the implementation of activities in 4 National Parks Natural PNN participating on the project to improve their sustainable management Monitoring and control activities have been held in 37811 ha of Tatamá Park and 10000 ha in Farallones National Park
Reports of field patroling and technical concepts of control and surveillance activities in the national parks were developed Tatamá and Farallones

description.narrative: Legal political and planning tools of national level include environmental and social criteria to preventmitigate offset and restore the impacts of mining on biodiversity and ecosystem services

comment.narrative: Legal political and planning existing toolsa Mining code b Required environmental license for the exploitation phase c Frame for environmental impact assessment

Updated tools legal political and planning with recommendations to include environmental and social criteria to preventmitigate offset and restore the impacts of mining on biodiversity and ecosystem services a Mining code b Environmental licensing process c Guidelines for designating areas in the mining reserve

Contributions and advice given by WWF in the design of the Strategic Environmental Assessment methodology for the mining sector on the meeting facilitated by the Planning National Department NPD

A documentmapping and analysis of stakeholders was constructedPublic and private organizations Civil organizations communities etc related with mining activity in the Pacific Region

description.narrative:
1) Superficie (ha) de cuatro (4) áreas protegidas existentes (AP) bajo gestión sostenible; protege los ecosistemas locales
2) Superficie total (ha) de bosque protegido por las nuevas áreas protegidas de uso múltiple (MUPAs) contra los impactos de la minería
3) Cambio en la efectividad de manejo de cuatro (4) áreas protegidas de acuerdo con la tarjeta de puntuación de efectividad

comment.narrative:
1) 0 Superficie (ha) de cuatro (4) áreas protegidas existentes (AP) bajo gestión sostenible
2) 0 Superficie total (ha) de bosque protegido por las nuevas áreas protegidas de uso múltiple (MUPAs) contra los impactos de la minería
3) efectividad de manejo de cuatro (4) áreas protegidas de acuerdo con la tarjeta de puntuación de efectividad : ? PNN Orquídeas 67 ? PNN Tatamá 43 ? PNN Farallones 53 ? PNN Munchique 70

Meta al final del proyecto: 1) 334,671 ha de cuatro (4) áreas protegidas existentes (AP) bajo gestión sostenible; protege los ecosistemas locales
2) 70.000 ha de bosque protegido por las nuevas áreas protegidas de uso múltiple (MUPAs) contra los impactos de la minería
3: Incremento del 20% efectividad de manejo de cuatro (4) áreas protegidas de acuerdo con la tarjeta de puntuación de efectividad :  PNN Orquídeas 80  PNN Tatamá 52  PNN Farallones 64  PNN Munchique 80

1) 334,671 ha bajo manejo sostenible en los parques nacionales naturales: Farallones, Tatamá, Munchique y La Orquídeas.
2) 547.058 ha declaradas (4 nuevas áreas protegidas): Distrito de Manejo Integrado Alto Atrato, Distrito de Manejo Integrado Bajo Baudó, Distrito Nacional de Manejo Integrado Cabo Manglares Bajo Mira y Frontera, Reserva Forestal Protectora Regional de Río Bravo.
3)  PNN Orquídeas 84  PNN Tatamá 66  PNN Farallones 78 PNN Munchique 80
Proyecto cerrado NA
Proyecto cerrado NA
Cierre operativo del proyecto Evaluación final elaborada Entrega de material divulgativo y lecciones aprendidas Eventos finales de cierre del proyecto

Se realizó la evaluación final del proyecto. Se consolidaron los resultados en terreno, logrando todos los indicadores propuestos y en muchos de ellos sobrepasando las metas programadas. Esta en proceso de impresión el material divulgativo final Los eventos de cierre se llevarán a cabo en el mes noviembre. Se construyó y radicó en el congreso la propuesta del proyecto de ley de reforma al código de minas que incluyó vacíos dejados en el Plan Nacional de Desarrollo. Se socializó y trabajó en el proyecto de ley de pasivos ambientales.
